item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I have nothing to declare except my genius." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Jacqueline Carey
item.description: "Why is there ever this perverse cruelty in humankind, that makes us hurt most those we love best?" -- Jacqueline Carey

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "here she is, all mine, trying her best to give me all she can. How could I ever hurt her? But I didn’t understand then. That I could hurt somebody so badly she would never recover. That a person can, just by living, damage another human being beyond repair." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "I felt a splinter of guilt wedge into my heart. Charlotte had hurt me; in return, I'd hurt Rob. Maybe that's what we do to the people we love: take shots in the dark and realize too late we've wounded the people we're trying to protect." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Lady Gaga
item.description: "Do you know the feeling, when your heart is so hurt, that you could feel the blood dripping?" -- Lady Gaga

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Becca Fitzpatrick
item.description: "Any happiness, no matter how brief, seemed better than the long, simmering torture of waking up day after day, knowing I could never have him." -- Becca Fitzpatrick

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Look, it's easy to outsmart a werewolf or a vampire," Jace said. "They're no smarter than anyone else. But faeries live for hundreds of years and they're as cunning as snakes. They can't lie, but they love to engage in creative truth-telling. They'll find out whatever it is you want most in the world and give it to you—with a sting in the tail of the gift that will make you regret you ever wanted it in the first place." He sighed. "They're not really about helping people. More about harm disguised as help." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Deb Caletti
item.description: "Unconditional love is like a contry of two with no laws and no government. Which is all fine if everyone is peaceful and law abiding. In the wrong hands, though, you got looting and crime sprees, and let me tell you, the people who demand unconditional love are usually the ones who will rob and pillage and then blame you because you left your door unlocked." -- Deb Caletti

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Scott Westerfield
item.description: "The human heart is a strange vessel. Love and hatred can exist side by side." -- Scott Westerfield

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "What you do, the way you think, makes you beautiful." -- Scott Westerfeld
